episodes.title: 55. Amanda Blackwood - Human Trafficking: Truths vs. Myths
episodes.description:
Episode 55 of the Healing & Growing Hand in Hand podcast dives into the stark realities of human traffi*king with the brave and resilient Amanda Blackwood as our guide.

In this episode, we peel back the layers on:
- The True Definition of Human Traffi*king: Move beyond the myths to understand the complex reality of this global issue.
- Unraveling Misconceptions: Amanda debunks common falsehoods and brings to light the truths of traffi*king that are often overlooked.
- Survival and Empowerment: Discover Amanda’s transformative journey from trauma to triumph, as she recounts her harrowing experiences and her path to becoming a trauma recovery mentor.
- The Importance of Legal and Social Reform: Learn about the critical changes needed in laws and society to protect victims and survivors of traffi*king.

About Amanda: With a past marked by hardship, Amanda Blackwood has emerged as a beacon of hope and strength. An artist, author, speaker, podcast host, and mentor, her work now focuses on aiding others in their healing, fueled by her deep personal faith and resilience.

Tune in to hear Amanda’s potent narrative, where she speaks candidly about her past and offers a powerful message of survival, hope, and action.

episodes.title: 43. Dana S. Diaz - Overcoming a Lifetime of Narcissistic Abusive
episodes.description:
Dana studied journalism and psychology at DePaul University. While there’s no better teacher than life experience and Dana has had life-long experiences with narcissistic abuse, her education did give her the ability to accurately verbalize and express how narcissistic abuse creates confusion and conflict within victims.

Today, Dana is a proud voice for fellow victims who are unable, afraid, or ashamed to share their experiences. She strives to create awareness and understanding to ensure victims are given the support they need to first understand their situation and then begin the healing process. Her first book, chronicling her own abusive marriage that lasted nearly three decades, started as a journal that she hid under the couch cushion in the basement.

episodes.title: Ep32: Christina Smith - Healing from Childhood Trauma, Shame, People-Pleasing & Perfectionism
episodes.description:
Christina Smith is a life coach specializing in confidence and self-love in midlife so that women can finally truly like themselves and how they show up for themselves and their relationships. She's helped people move through tough transitions in coaching and with her book, Inviting Shift. Her focus is on helping women to empower themselves so they can make their second half the best half by dropping the people-pleasing and perfection and stepping into desire, authenticity and joy.
 
Christina is also the host of The Inviting Shift Podcast - a place for midlife women to embrace their uniqueness and truth with confidence. The  mission is to help women reinvent midlife so we can revolutionize how we see aging and ourselves as we age. She encourages people to be more gentle with their humanness so they can truly shine the way they choose to without gratitude lists or toxic positivity.

episodes.title: Ep13: Dr. Joe Kort, Ph.D - How Childhood Trauma Affects Men
episodes.description:
Dr. Joe Kort is a psychotherapist, certified sex therapist and clinical director of The Center for Relationship Health in Royal Oak, Michigan. He is the author of four books and a lecturer and facilitator of therapeutic workshops. Throughout his 37 years of private practice, he has successfully helped hundreds of individuals and couples improve their lives and strengthen their relationships. Dr. Kort specializes in marital problems and conflicts; mixed orientation marriages; male sexuality and out-of-control sexual behaviors. He is EMDR trained and offers LGBTQIA Affirmative Therapy.
